## Packages

```{r}
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
```

## Data Import

```{r}
claims <- read_csv("claims.csv")
```

## Data Cleaning
```{r}
claims_clean <- claims %>%
  filter(STATUS1 == "BILLED") %>%  # Correct comparison operator
  select(Id, DIAGNOSIS1, CURRENTILLNESSDATE) %>%
  mutate(TAX = ifelse(is.numeric(DIAGNOSIS1), DIAGNOSIS1 * 0.1, 0)) %>%  # Check if numeric
  arrange(desc(DIAGNOSIS1)) %>%
  summarize(
    total_amount = sum(DIAGNOSIS1, na.rm = TRUE),
    avg_amount = mean(DIAGNOSIS1, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_tax = sum(TAX, na.rm = TRUE)
  )


```

## Data Visualization
```{r}
p<-ggplot(claims, aes(x = DIAGNOSIS1)) +  # Change to appropriate variable
  geom_histogram(bins = 30L, fill = "#112446") +
  theme_minimal()
ggplotly(p)
```
